arm_group.description: "Laser group": a pre-fragmentation of the ocular lens will be performed by VICTUS femtosecond laser lens fragmentation procedure.
"Manual": manual group acts as a control group where the lens fragmentation are performed manually without femtosecond laser assisted lens fragmentation

brief_summary.textblock:
This clinical study is a prospective, post-market-clinical-follow-up study to investigate
      the long-term (3 months) safety of femtosecond laser assisted cataract surgery as a study
      follow-up extension to the Study #1304 titled as "A Multi-centre, Multi-surgeon, Randomized,
      Controlled, Prospective, Post-Market-Clinical-Follow-Up Study to Investigate the Impact of
      Cataract Grade on the Efficacy and Safety of Femtosecond-laser Assisted Lens Fragmentation
      Procedure".

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term (3 Months) Safety of Femtosecond-laser Assisted Cataract Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Only the patients who were successfully enrolled in Study #1304 are eligible for this
        follow-up extension study.

intervention.description: The VICTUS lens fragmentation procedure is part of the femtosecond laser assisted cataract procedure, which generates precise cuts inside the cataractous lens, leading to a softening and fragmentation of the lens.
"Manual": manual group acts as a control group where the lens fragmentation are per-formed manually without femtosecond laser assisted lens fragmentation

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Post-Market-Clinical-Follow-Up Study to Investigate the Long-term (3 Months) Safety of Femtosecond-laser Assisted Cataract Surgery

overall_official.affiliation: MaxiVision Laser Centre Private Limited, Hyderabad, India
MaxiVision Laser Centre Private Limited, Hyderabad, India

primary_outcome.description: Less or equal adverse events (e.g. retinal detachment, intraocular lens (IOL) malposition, etc.) in "Laser group" (pooled from all cataract grades) compared with "Manual group" (pooled from all cataract grades); p<0.05 will be considered statistically significant. The primary study end point is only based on adverse events and severe adverse events which are related to the treatment procedures.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
